I got this FREE game the day it came out, as i'm a big fan of pool games. Alas, it leaves much to be desired, based on the version up to and including the patch on 16th March. See below:

PROS:

- It's fun enough to play while watching the telly, for a time, and if you've nothing else to do.
- It's free.

CONS:

- Extremely derivative: It's a pool game clone, and a poor one at that. It is outdone, not only by the majority of browser-based pool games, but also by the likes of Arcade Pool for the Amiga, which is now over 20 years old.

- Putting spin on the ball has barely any effect whasoever. This needs to be ramped up significantly. I enjoy playing pool, though i consider myself an amateur, and even i can put triple the amount of spin on the cue ball as this game allows. As such, many shots which would be easy enough in real life (and most other pool games) are impossible here.

- Only one mode of play: 8-Ball

- Poor matchmaking, which can mean waiting forever for a game, even when there was an odd number of people in the sparsely-populated rooms. I've left it running for about 8 minutes without getting a game. However, exiting out of the room and rejoining seemingly got me a game much quicker than just waiting in the queue, indicating a glitch.

It's a very simple pool game without anything special to it - and that can be a positive thing, too. A quick game of pool is just one click away, no need to think about settings things up - just click and play. On the other hand it feels like there's a lot of missed potential: game modes, custom game settings (no aim assist for either player etc.), score lists and matches (e.g. play five games against a friend in challenge mode and keep score). Maybe the game should have been named Simple Pool instead of Premium Pool because that name would have been more descriptive for this exact game.

Pros:
+ It's free to play
+ Simple and quick to play
+ Simple match-making
+ Challenge mode

Cons:
- No game modes
- No game setup possibility
- Shop prices feel quite high - there should be more mid-prized content
- Not enough basic avatars (everyone I play against has the same face - quite tiring)
- Just not enough content and features overall

reviewText:
When I first saw the game, I automatically knew it would be a game that I would like! This game is a good pool simulator that will quickly grab your attention. Although, there are some cons about this game  that you really should know before getting this game.

Most games have a way for you to practice the gameplay that you will come across while playing. When you think of this, you imagine a trainer that is going to go easy on you and you slowly start to get better as you continue! But no! Not this game! The practice mode isn't any easier than playing the regular game itself! In fact, it is probably harder than playing against a high-leveled player! The practice mode is pretty much just a computer with AimBot, and this bot perfectly makes every single shot without even taking more than 5 seconds to think! When I was doing the practice, I honestly began to wonder why these people even added a practice mode! I also wondered why this bot isn't at the top of the leaderboard... Not only that, but the practice mode always makes you hit the ball first, pretty much giving the bot a 95% chance to win without you even being able to do anything in the game! At that point, I wanted to repetitively bang my head against my desk!

Shouldn't most games be able to connect you to a game or game lobby within a matter of seconds. Most games I know do that, but nooooooooo. Premium Pool not only has a huge problem connecting with other players to start a match, but it also has a problem staying connected. In order to get into a match, you have to pay coins, and if you lose connection, you also lose the coins! I was expecting to have an estimated 5-10 seconds to connect to a match, but this game can take 20 seconds up to a minute just to connect to a match with another player. I was able to go downstairs, pour myself a glass of water, drink it all, and successfully make it back to my computer before this game even connected to a match!

You thought it ended there? I didn't mention this game has huge amounts of lag? You could hit the cue ball in the opposite dirrection of the hole, and a lag spike will bring the ball right back and give you another chance. This game crashes more than a 2 year old flying an RC Helicopter! I didn't even know it could get that bad...

In conclusion... you will have an easier time getting a whale halfway across the earth than trying to play this game. Hopefully this helped you all! ;)

You start off with 250 gold coins and you can purchase more through steam. At that rate, however, it will take quite a few games to purchase some of the low level items in the store.

As far as game play and the physics etc, its not bad.  The aiming lines help but, without them, making shots is nearly impossible without a lot of practice.....and I mean A LOT OF PRACTICE.

From what I can see, 8 Ball is the only game vairant available at this time.  I would rather have seen the game start off with 9 Ball.  But, that's really a matter of personal preference, I suppose.

Since the game is free, I will recommend it.  Its not a bad start to a game that has some decent, but, limited potential.   They really need to fix that connectivity thing if they have any hope of this game getting out of the starting gate.

Because of the failures of multiplayer, it becomes unrealistic that a player will be able to actually customize to their wishes without having to purchase everyting with money. For a casual game.

-Challenge mode doesn't seem to work at all

-Offline play has no AI, only 1v1 human local play.




How to make Cons into Pros
-Unlock all customization options, don't require purchases for them. IT'S A CASUAL-PLAY GAME!
-Fix the multiplayer servers
-Implement offline AI
-Get rid of or fix Challenge mode

reviewText:
PROS

It's free
Low spec requirements

CONS

There are much better pool games out there that are also free
Buggy and laggy
Match making takes too long even with people online
Doesn't feel like a very good pool game in terms of physics or realism
8 ball pool only no 9 ball or other game modes
Many micro-transactions and ingame purchases

Can't recommend I'm afraid! Thought I'd enjoy this as it looks a lot like Mini Clip Pool the web browser game and 8 Ball the mobile phone game. Unfortunately it's not as polished and not very good. Just play those games if you want a free simple pool game.

This game takes a while to find an opponent due to hardly anyone being on line I managed 3 games in 40 minutes. I lost one, won one and the other game I left because the shot clock disappeared the game lagged out and before I knew it the other played had potted 3 balls whilst I was still lining up my shot. It then got stuck on my previous shot and nothing was happening. I'm on 72mb fibre with 5-10 ping on other games, pretty bad from a game that's basically browser based.

There's not really any skill involved this game unlike other pool games. The game I won I just lined up every shot and hit at full power. There isn't really any need for back spin, side spin or anything else as the physics and balls don't work that well. I know it's only overhead 2D pool but there's other pool games out there with semi or better realism. You should at least have consequence for smashing every shot without thought but I never potted the white or a wrong ball. Maybe I'll try this again after they patch it a few times but not that bothered to be honest. This could have been a cool time breaker for those odd 10-15 minutes spells when I'm patching or installing but it's terrible.

reviewText:
An example of a pay wall game done right.  While I don't think it's that groundbreaking of a game, it doesn't stop you from playing after a while, forcing you to pay to continue, which I can appreciate.  You CAN buy things in game with real money if you're impatient, but you can also EARN coins in game to do the same.

What else i there to say other than the classic game of pool has never been better.  Sadly, I do have to dock it because it is still a microtransaction game, but the things you can buy are purely cosmetic and don't change the overall feel.  THAT IS HOW IT SHOULD BE DONE!

Do I recommend it though?  Well, if you like a simple game that you can pick up and play without having to learn a whole textbook of rules, then you really can't get much simpler and classic than pool.  So yes, I do recommend this one for any pool enthusiast or casual gamer.  I'd even recommend it to the hardcore gamers who may need a break from their edgy games.

reviewText:
This game is fun if you like to play some pool, but I do have a few areas that could be looked at.

1.) You have to wait an hour to receive your 250 gold player tokens, which I'm glad it's not 24 hours or something, but still.
2.) I have still yet to understand, without looking online, how to win the rubys without purchasing them with real monies.
3.) ***WHEN THE GAME LAGS OUT, one can lose their turn, lose the game, and I have also experienced (one occurance) times when I would win on my last 50 gold player tokens and then the game tells me to restart and I do then I'm at zero gold player tokens somehow and have to wait an hour or purchase more.
4.) One cannot give gold player tokens to friends. I think that should be expanded for the pure aspect of sharing, lol.
5.) ***MAJOR BOTHER of mine is that we cannot chose to play by real pool rules. I may be part of the few, but I don't like playing slop.

OTHERWISE, I think it's a pretty straight forward pool game and I have put quite a few hours of enjoyment and frustration into it! PLAY ON!!
